Posts.Content: rayofsun wrote: I was dxd with 3c in oct 2009. Had neoadjuvant chemo for 6 months. Had one positive sentinel node and a mam node light up on PET scan. Had complete response from chemo! Did tamoxifen for 1.5 years. Ovaries removed in Jan 2011 and started AI's in March 2011. Have taken some doctor prescribed breaks and switched types of AI's. Since AI's had lower back surgery and a knee replacement. I am 55 and active. I feel my body deteriorating and am thinking of stopping the AI's. Thoughts. My Onc says it's up to me. Reoccurrence not a worry but showing up distantly could be. brca neg.SNB 10/09, bilateral mastectomy 4/10. DIEP , ooph and tubes removed 1/5.11.. started breast cancer vaccine study for her2 positive at hopkins on feb 2011. Dx 9/30/2009, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IIIC, Grade 2, 1/25 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Aromatase inhibitors help rayofsun rayofsun

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2010 12:31AM rayofsun wrote: when is your biopsy, i say keep busy until you find out results and know what needs to be done if anything. i undrstand your stress. ray
Posts.Title: I am so stressed out!!!! dmho Lawleigh

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2011 07:07PM - edited Jan 15, 2011 07:10PM by rayofsun fath, I had extreme leg pain in november, at first thought it was a clot, from tamoxifen and had a doppler which showed it was not. It did not get better and would hurt at night and was extremely painful. needless to say I was scared.I saw an ortho who did an xray which showed nothing and then I saw my onc who ordered a pet scan, they wanted an mri too but I could not because I had expanders then. The scans came back good and eventually it was decided I had a bakers cyst and some arthritis.  I go thru periods of thinking my cancer will return but these are usually short lived. It does not matter how much support you have, I believe cancer is very personailized and no 2 people share the same journey and it can be lonely. When I get to those lonely times I also try to make them short lived. Ray

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2010 07:10PM rayofsun wrote: I saw the plastic surgeon physician assistant today.  I did not have staples or sutures to be removed as i had glue to close the incisons. I was told my incisions look good. The 2 drains I have are remaining in as i am draining too much at this time. My range of motion is improved with the daily prescribed exercises. I still am not allowed to lift more than 2 lbs. As far as pain stopped percocet on saturday am using ibuprofen, the majority of the pain is from the expanders tenderness, when the drains are pulled they will fill them. ray

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2010 10:32PM rayofsun wrote: i had my surgery on april 15th as planned.i had only been on the computer short periods to update this thread. Was being treated by a PT for mild lymphedema with gentle massage i week before. The PT met me pre surgery and wrapped my arm which did well thru sugery.Before they called me to the OR i went to the bathroom myself and looked at my boobs one last time and said a prayer. I got very tearful right after I kissed my husband and going into the OR. There was this one tech who held my hand until I fell asleep which helped.The procedure went well, was 5 hrs but was in recovery 5 hrs cause my heart rate was up and i was very groggy.My sister stayed the night. I went home early the next afternoon on perocet 2 tabs which i decreased to one because i was restless, today i am doing ibuprofen and percocet at night.I took my first shower saturday, i have 2 drains andsurgical glue on the incisions. I have been sleeping well in bed with a bed wedge and plenty of pillows. Been keeping up with my exercises and they seem to help with pain and tightness issues. So thats where things are with me. Sending everyone my best. ray
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: May 4, 2010 06:59PM rayofsun wrote: My second drain came out on may 1 st and yesterday am i woke up and had the issue of not being able to put my arms to my side. I had fluid build up and had it removed from the PS on both sides, first I got my first fill which I did not feel at all going in and then was drained. I could feel the fluid being pulled out, did not hurt but was a weird sensation. I was told I can start wearing sports bras which i am, I wore and wear the compression bra but find the camisole I was given to be too hot. I see my PT on friday, seesm like the lymphedema I was having is staying under control now. ray
